Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RR-12Whydro (Arg-rich; Leu-rich; synthetic AMPs, UCLL1c, XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (91.67%) toRR-12R: 42%; L: 42%: I=W: 8%. GRAVY: 0.0083; M Wt: 1664.128; Mol formula: C77H139N28O13; molar extinction coeff: 5550.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli BL21DE3 (MIC 8 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC 4 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC13883 (MIC 4 uM), S. enterica ATCC14028 (MIC 8 uM), Gram+ B. subtilis (MIC 4 uM), S. aureus ATCC25923 (MIC 4 uM), S. pyogenes ATCC19615 (MIC 4 uM), E. feacalis ATCC29212 (MIC 4 uM).Antimicrobial robustness: salt-insensitive: NaCl-insensitive:E. coli; NaCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa; NaCl-insensitive:K. pneumoniae; NaCl-insensitive:S. enterica; NaCl-insensitive:B. subtilis;  NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus; NaCl-insensitive:S. pyogenes; NaCl-insensitive:E. feacalis.   tested at 150 and 300 mM. Also, activity is maintained in 10% human serum.Toxicity: dose-depedent hemolysis HC50 >>100 uM. Less Hemo.lytic. Provided by Arjun Nair.
Literature Information.Author: Mohanram H, Bhattacharjya S.2016
Literature Information.Title: Salt-Resistant Short Antimicrobial Peptides
